intro: Hepetis muscosa, commonly known as the hairy vetch, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is characterized by its trailing growth habit and compound leaves with hairy surfaces, which give it its common name. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that range in color from white to purple, depending on the variety. Its root system has the ability to fix atmospheric nitrogen, making it valuable in soil enrichment. Hepetis muscosa is often used as a cover crop and forage plant due to its hardy nature and adaptability to various soil types.
